Key Match Events: Steph Curry exited the game with an ankle injury after sustaining blows to his left leg twice during the game.
Andrew Wiggins scored 29 points on 11 of 15 shots.
The Clippers had three players scoring 20+ points each.
Post-Match Reflections: The Warriors struggled in the minutes Curry wasn't on the court, leading to a five-point first-half deficit.
The Warriors were down 10 when Curry exited the game.
The outcome may have been different if the Warriors had Curry playing as he was in a better rhythm than the previous two outings.
The Warriors will hope Curry's injury doesn't hurt them in the long run as their hopes of success rely heavily on him without a second bonafide All-Star on the roster.
